abstracts.cdata!:
After years of political instability and
            neglect, Ghana's economy laid in shambles in the
            mid-1980s. The transport sector had deteriorated badly, and
            the road network was in such poor condition that it hindered
            the government's 1983 economy recovery program. Since
            1987, the World Bank has aided the country's transport
            sector with three projects designed to raise the
            sector's efficiency, and expand exports and farm
            production. The projects helped build and repair thousands
            of kilometers of roads, and succeeded in removing transport
            bottlenecks, promoting market-oriented reforms, and
            improving public sector management and resource allocation.
